pente

Class PentePanel

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.awt.Component
      • java.awt.Container
        • javax.swing.JComponent
          • javax.swing.JPanel
            • pente.PentePanel
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, javax.accessibility.Accessible

    public class PentePanel
extends javax.swing.JPanel
    A PentePanel is a JPanel that contains a GridView where pieces will be placed on grid line intersections rather than within grid lines. In order to use a PentePanel, one should access and operate on its GridView object which can be obtained by calling getGridView(). Here's how a PentePanel is built: Imagine two pieces of graph paper placed so their grid lines match up. Now shift the top paper one-half square down and one-half square right. Then erase the grid lines from the top paper and make the paper transparent so the bottom grid lines show through. The effect looks like you are playing on grid lines when in fact you are playing on an invisible grid above the grid lines. This is exactly how a PentePanel works.
    Author:
    eric_ferrante
    See Also:

    • Constructor Detail

      • PentePanel

        public PentePanel(int rows,
                  int cols,
                  int cellSize,
                  int gridLineThickness,
                  java.util.Observable observeObj)
        Constructs a new PentePanel from the given info.
        Parameters:
        rows - Number of rows on the Pente board
        cols - Number of columns on the Pente board
        cellSize - Cell size in pixels (which determines the overall JPanel size)
        gridLineThickness - Grid line thickness in pixels
        observeObj - An observable object the GridView will monitor for changes. In Pente, this is the Board.
